Posts.EditableText: You don't need to use destroy unless for some reason you're dynamically creating a lot of objects. It is quicker just to hide an object. You won't save much memory by destroying - and you won't save any unless the player saves and reloads, because "undo" will keep a reference to the destroyed object anyway.
